batchYeasts.description: Abbaye is an ale yeast of Belgian origin. Selected for its ability to ferment Belgian style beers ranging from low to high alcohol, Abbaye produces the spiciness and fruitiness typical of Belgian and Trappist style ales.
batchYeasts.name: Abbaye Belgian

boilSteps.name: 150g Sugar, Table (Sucrose), 1g Irish Moss, 1items Wort Chiller

Fermentation Profile Step:
Ramp to 22 °C over 2 days - Diacetyl rest

batchHops.notes: Unique very floral/spicy aroma with good bittering quality. Cascade has a unique floral/spicy aroma both in the cone form and in the beer,mainly due to abnormal levels of some of the essential oils. It is very popular with some brewers due to the unique character imparted to the finished beer, it has a“perfume like” hoppy flavour. Trial brews and tastings also show a superior bitterness quality with Cascade even at high EBU levels (40+) there is little harshness or lingering bitterness.
batchHops.name: Cascade (T90)

hops.notes: Unique very floral/spicy aroma with good bittering quality. Cascade has a unique floral/spicy aroma both in the cone form and in the beer,mainly due to abnormal levels of some of the essential oils. It is very popular with some brewers due to the unique character imparted to the finished beer, it has a“perfume like” hoppy flavour. Trial brews and tastings also show a superior bitterness quality with Cascade even at high EBU levels (40+) there is little harshness or lingering bitterness.
